import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import plotly_express as ex
source.ccdc1d5f:
isna=df.isna().sum()
fig=go.Figure()
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=isna.index,y=isna))
fig.update_layout(title="NA by Columns", title_x=0.5,
                                    xaxis_title='Feature',
                                    yaxis_title='Number of NA')
source.b87a7812:
number_manufacter=df['Name'].str.split(' ').str[0].value_counts()
fig=go.Figure()
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=number_manufacter[:10].index,y=number_manufacter[:10]))
fig.update_layout(title="Manufacturers with most number of Ads", title_x=0.5,
                                    xaxis_title='Manufacturer Name',
                                    yaxis_title='Number of Cars listed')
source.fb749fa2:
top10=df['Name'].value_counts()[0:10]
fig=go.Figure()
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=top10.index,y=top10))
fig.update_layout(title="Top 10 cars with most number of Ads", title_x=0.5,
                                    xaxis_title='Name',
                                    yaxis_title='Number of Cars listed')
source.cf7ce8bb:
b10=df['Name'].value_counts()[-10:]
fig=go.Figure()
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=b10.index,y=b10))
fig.update_layout(title="Cars with Least number of Ads", title_x=0.5,
                                    xaxis_title='Name',
                                    yaxis_title='Number of Cars listed')
source.57fa34ee:
engine_cap=df["Engine Capacity"].value_counts()
fig=go.Figure()
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=engine_cap.index,y=engine_cap))
fig.update_layout(title="Number of Cars by Engine Capacity", title_x=0.5,
                                    xaxis_title='Engine Size',
                                    yaxis_title='Number of Cars')
